title: Mahindra BE 6, XEV 9e bookings open tomorrow; 1,837 units despatched to dealers in January
description: The Mahindra BE 6 and XEV 9e born-electric SUVs can be booked starting tomorrow. In January, the carmaker produced 2,281 units of these models and despatched 1,837 units to its dealers. The model-wise split for the BE 6 and XEV 9e is not known.  Deliveries for Mahindra BE 6 and XEV 9e top-spec variants to start in March Entry-level and mid-spec variants’ deliveries will begin in a phased manner The price range is Rs 18.90 lakh-26.90 lakh for BE 6 and Rs 21.90 lakh-30.50 lakh for XEV 9e Mahindra BE 6 price list (ex-showroom)Variant PriceDelivery Pack One (59kWh)Rs 18.90 lakhAugust 2025Pack One Above (59kWh)Rs 20.50 lakh August 2025Pack Two (59kWh)Rs 21.90 lakh July 2025Pack Three Select (59kWh)Rs 24.50 lakh June 2025Pack Three (79kWh)Rs 26.90 lakh Mid-March 2025 For context, the current EV market leader, Tata Motors, despatched 5,240 all-electric vehicles in January. Tata’s EV portfolio comprises five models: the Tiago EV, Tigor EV, Punch EV, Nexon EV and Curvv EV. In fact, the Curvv EV (Rs 17.49 lakh-21.99 lakh) is one of the BE 6’s direct rivals. Mahindra recently revealed prices for the full BE 6 range (Rs 18.90 lakh-26.90 lakh), and the midsize e-SUV received a 5-star Bharat NCAP safety rating shortly before the price announcement. Mahindra XEV 9e price list (ex-showroom)Variant Price Deliveries Pack One (59kWh)Rs 21.90 lakh August 2025Pack Two (59kWh)Rs 24.90 lakhJuly 2025Pack Three Select (59kWh)Rs 27.90 lakhJune 2025Pack Three (79kWh)Rs 30.50 lakh Mid-March 2025 While the Mahindra XEV 9e has no direct rivals currently, its Rs 21.90 lakh-30.50 lakh price range pits it against the BYD Atto 3 (Rs 24.99 lakh-33.99 lakh). Tata’s Harrier EV, which is scheduled to arrive in the coming months, will take on the XEV 9e. As we’ve reported, deliveries will begin in mid-March for the range-topping variants, and for other variants, they’ll start in a phased manner from June to August. Both of Mahindra’s e-SUVs are powered by either a 59kWh battery and a 231hp, 380Nm rear-mounted motor or a 79kWh battery and 286hp, 380Nm rear motor. The ARAI-certified ranges for the 59kWh and 79kWh BE 6 are 556km and 682km, respectively; for the XEV 9e, the figures are 542km and 656km. html:
Mahindra’s official numbers for January also show that 2,281 units of the BE 6 and XEV 9e have rolled out of its Chakan plant.

The Mahindra BE 6 and XEV 9e born-electric SUVs can be booked starting tomorrow. In January, the carmaker produced 2,281 units of these models and despatched 1,837 units to its dealers. The model-wise split for the BE 6 and XEV 9e is not known. 

  1. Deliveries for Mahindra BE 6 and XEV 9e top-spec variants to start in March
  2. Entry-level and mid-spec variants’ deliveries will begin in a phased manner
  3. The price range is Rs 18.90 lakh-26.90 lakh for BE 6 and Rs 21.90 lakh-30.50 lakh for XEV 9e
Mahindra BE 6 price list (ex-showroom)
VariantPriceDelivery
Pack One (59kWh)Rs 18.90 lakhAugust 2025
Pack One Above (59kWh)Rs 20.50 lakhAugust 2025
Pack Two (59kWh)Rs 21.90 lakhJuly 2025
Pack Three Select (59kWh)Rs 24.50 lakhJune 2025
Pack Three (79kWh)Rs 26.90 lakhMid-March 2025

For context, the current EV market leader, Tata Motors, despatched 5,240 all-electric vehicles in January. Tata’s EV portfolio comprises five models: the Tiago EV, Tigor EV, Punch EV, Nexon EV and Curvv EV. In fact, the Curvv EV (Rs 17.49 lakh-21.99 lakh) is one of the BE 6’s direct rivals. Mahindra recently revealed prices for the full BE 6 range (Rs 18.90 lakh-26.90 lakh), and the midsize e-SUV received a 5-star Bharat NCAP safety rating shortly before the price announcement.

Mahindra XEV 9e price list (ex-showroom)
VariantPriceDeliveries
Pack One (59kWh)Rs 21.90 lakhAugust 2025
Pack Two (59kWh)Rs 24.90 lakhJuly 2025
Pack Three Select (59kWh)Rs 27.90 lakhJune 2025
Pack Three (79kWh)Rs 30.50 lakhMid-March 2025

While the Mahindra XEV 9e has no direct rivals currently, its Rs 21.90 lakh-30.50 lakh price range pits it against the BYD Atto 3 (Rs 24.99 lakh-33.99 lakh). Tata’s Harrier EV, which is scheduled to arrive in the coming months, will take on the XEV 9e.

As we’ve reported, deliveries will begin in mid-March for the range-topping variants, and for other variants, they’ll start in a phased manner from June to August.

Both of Mahindra’s e-SUVs are powered by either a 59kWh battery and a 231hp, 380Nm rear-mounted motor or a 79kWh battery and 286hp, 380Nm rear motor. The ARAI-certified ranges for the 59kWh and 79kWh BE 6 are 556km and 682km, respectively; for the XEV 9e, the figures are 542km and 656km.
